item.title: RT by @rauschma: The State of #WebAssembly '22 survey results are in! As @ColinEberhardt explains, they make for fascinating reading. The use of #wasm for serverless, containerisation and as a plug-in technology has leapt considerably with WASI becoming ever more important https://bit.ly/3nqLNNM
item.dc:creator: @Scott_Logic
item.description:
The State of #WebAssembly '22 survey results are in! As @ColinEberhardt explains, they make for fascinating reading. The use of #wasm for serverless, containerisation and as a plug-in technology has leapt considerably with WASI becoming ever more important

item.title:
Node.js on Windows: child_process.spawn() seems to require options¬∑shell===true.
I tried several invocations with .shell===false that worked on macOS and they all failed (but worked if it was `true`).
https://nodejs.org/api/child_process.html#child_processspawncommand-args-options
item.dc:creator: @rauschma
item.description:
Node.js on Windows: child_process.spawn() seems to require options¬∑shell===true.

I tried several invocations with .shell===false that worked on macOS and they all failed (but worked if it was `true`).

nodejs.org/api/child_process‚Ä¶

item.title:
RT by @rauschma: 16% of the web uses web maps. Should HTML have a new element for maps?
We worked together with @NRCan to conduct static analysis research, survey web developers, and conduct interviews culminating in a multiyear roadmap. You can read more it here! üåê
https://bocoup.com/blog/no-neutral-map
item.dc:creator: @bocoup

item.title:
RT by @rauschma: We're live with the home page of the V8 Clog! The latest 3 versions of V8 are up.
Still a bunch to do, but I expect to be done with these by end-of-week: - List of all entries at /clog - Direct links to entries at /clog/:version - RSS feed
Check it out!
https://v8clog.deno.dev
item.dc:creator: @AaronHugginsDev
item.description:
We're live with the home page of the V8 Clog! The latest 3 versions of V8 are up.

Still a bunch to do, but I expect to be done with these by end-of-week:

- Direct links to entries at /clog/:version

item.title:
RT by @rauschma: This is big. After 2 years of hard work, @svgeesus and I are finally ‚Äúofficially‚Äù releasing our library Color.js into the wild! üåàüé®üéâ
My blog post: https://lea.verou.me/2022/06/releasing-colorjs/ Chris‚Äô blog post: https://svgees.us/blog/colorjs-release.html Color.js: https://colorjs.io npm: https://npmjs.com/package/colorjs.io

item.title:
RT by @rauschma: To demonstrate executing shell commands via Node.js, I was looking for code that works on Windows CMD and Unix shells. My current favorite:
(echo c && echo b && echo a) | sort
item.dc:creator: @rauschma
item.description:
To demonstrate executing shell commands via Node.js, I was looking for code that works on Windows CMD and Unix shells. My current favorite:

(echo c && echo b && echo a) | sort

item.title:
R to @rauschma: Window Command shell‚Äîcopying and running ESM code via Node.js:
powershell get-clipboard | node --input-type=module
item.dc:creator: @rauschma
item.description:
Window Command shell‚Äîcopying and running ESM code via Node.js:

item.title:
RT by @rauschma: Can we acknowledge how ridiculous it is that startups and even individuals can bankrupt themselves...
... with an AWS bill?
I cannot fathom why Amazon does not do anything meaningful to allow setting e.g. limits on accounts. Why do we need to hear stories like this on repeat?
item.dc:creator: @GergelyOrosz
item.description:
Can we acknowledge how ridiculous it is that startups and even individuals can bankrupt themselves...

... with an AWS bill?

I cannot fathom why Amazon does not do anything meaningful to allow setting e.g. limits on accounts. Why do we need to hear stories like this on repeat?

item.title: R to @erikras: I‚Äôd like to use tabs (for accessibility reasons), but copying code to other environments doesn‚Äôt always work well: Twitter removes tabs, LaTeX must be configured, etc. Most obstacles are gone now, though.

item.description: I‚Äôd like to use tabs (for accessibility reasons), but copying code to other environments doesn‚Äôt always work well: Twitter removes tabs, LaTeX must be configured, etc. Most obstacles are gone now, though.

item.dc:creator: @rauschma
item.description:
In HTML, we can use the CSS property `tab-size`:

<pre style="tab-size: 4">
function add(x, y) {
return (
x + y;
);
}
</pre>

Sadly, Twitter removes tabs, thus (macOS): copy and ‚Ä¶

pbpaste | sed -e 's/ /\t/g' | pbcopy

item.title:
You can now set the tab size on GitHub: https://github.blog/changelog/2021-09-21-tab-size-rendering-preference/
At this URL: https://github.com/settings/appearance
item.dc:creator: @rauschma
item.description:
